editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Thompson Family Charitable Trust

msDesc.head: Reginald, canon of Shede, Dogma laicorum; sermon book of Philip, vicar of Wycombe; Grosseteste, Constitutions; Physiologus

supportDesc.support: Comprising four originally separate MSS, all on vellum (MSS 1 and 4 HSOS/HFFH, MSS 2 and 3 FSOS/FHHF).
supportDesc.extent:
Fols. iii + 123 + iii.
220 150
after fol. 109, 200 mm x 135–45 mm.

binding.p: A modern replacement. Sewn on five thongs. At the front, a marbled paper leaf and two modern paper flyleaves; at the rear, two modern paper flyleaves and another marbled leaf (iv–vi).

provenance.p: A vast amount of material relating to ownership of manuscript 2 in the mid- or later s. xiii: material copied in a single hand, s. xiii med., in the lower margins of manuscript 2, including copies of letters. The most explicitly dated entry occurs on fol. 81v: ‘Anno domini MoCoCo sexagesimo primo Memorandum quod eodem anno recepit vicarius de Wycumb de blado de santerdune De ordeo et dras mixto xxj. quart. v. sol.’ (and similar notes on payments for church duties on fol. 81).

This association is strengthened by three letters from ‘Philippus perpetuus vicarius ecclesie de Wycumbe’ to various addressees: to ‘Dilectis sibi in cristo fratribus suis ’ (fols. 96v–7); to ‘Magistro R de stratune seculari’ (fols. 100v–1v); and to ‘Magistro Iohanni de Cuntune’ (fol. 107v, the conclusion on fol. 108 cut away); lacking Philip’s name but inferentially his as well, are letters addressed to ‘ nerabili et discreto Domino W Magistro de Godestowe’ (fols. 83v–4); and to ‘Magister karissime Cornien’ (fol. 102). The only letter here definitely not by Philip is from one of his addressees: ‘El’e Cuntesse de Warewyk frere Water de Godestowe maunde salut’ (fol. 104v).

In addition, a number of accounts and documentary entries record (? Philip’s) dealings in Northampton and Havering (? Essex), e.g. ‘Memorandum quod persona de hauering debet michi primo pro ligatura librorum suorum de hau Item pro oleo ad comburendum in cancello suo misso apud Oxonias coram priore sancti Andree Norhamtonie pro detur qui stetit ibi per tres dies xij. d Item ad portandum apud Norhamt’ Item ad oblata facienda diacono de hauering xij. d’ (fol. 88v).

history.provenance: ‘Wll’s de Walton’ (fol. 111v, upper margin; s. xiv).
Records of payments from a series of individuals, including Simon koc, Ioh’ danner, Cristian Ranlot, Randulfus Pellipp, Rob’ godesspayn (fol. 1rb, lower margin, s. xv/xvi).

‘Liber Richardi Butler rectoris de Aston in Le wallis ex dono Magistri Albani senioris 2 Decembris 1607’ (fol. 1, upper margin). The references to St Andrew, Northampton (OClun) cited under 1 above are suggestive, since the College’s two books from the house (MSS 20, 39) were Butler’s donations.
S. xvii list of contents (fol. 1, outer margin).
history.acquisition: ‘Liber Collegij Sanctj Johannis Baptistae Oxon ex dono Richardi Butler Doctoris Theologiae Archidiaconi Northampt’ (fol. 1, lower margin).

source.bibl: Ralph Hanna, A descriptive catalogue of the western medieval manuscripts of St. John's College, Oxford (Oxford: Oxford University Press, 2002)

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact St John's College Library.

listBibl.bibl: E J. Carmody (ed.), Physiologus latinus: Editions préliminaires versio B (Paris, 1939).
C. R. Cheney, English Synodalia of the Thirteenth Century, 2nd edn. (London, 1968).
C. L. Kingsford (ed.), The Song of Lewes (Oxford, 1890).
E M. Powicke and C. R. Cheney (ed.), Councils and Synods… II (Oxford, 1964).
Johannes Baptist Schneyer, Repertorium der lateinischen Sermones des Mittelalters für die Zeit von 1150-1350, 11 vols. (Münster i. W., 1969–90).
Richard Sharpe, A Handlist of the Latin Writers of Great Britain and Ireland before 1540. Publications of the Journal of Medieval Latin 1 (Turnhout, 1997).
S. Harrison Thomson, ‘Three Anglo-Norman translations of the Veni Creator Spiritus’, Medium Aevum 8 (1939), 33–9.
Hans Walther, Initia carminum ac versuum Medii Aevi posterioris Latinorum, 2nd edn (Göttingen, 1969).

msItem.rubric: Breuis prelibacio de continencia et ordine huius libri
msItem.incipit: Sacerdotibus uniuersis ad quorum manus presens scriptum peruenerit frater REGINALDUS nomine tenus SHEDENSIS ecclesie canonicus salutem in domino Quanta diligencia et quam sollicite sedulitatis obseruancia sit ouibus cristi pascendis
msItem.rubric: [fol. 1va, the text] Dogma laicorum De quadrifaria theologye doctrina
msItem.incipit: Omnis sermo diuinus aud hystoricus est aud mysticus Hystoria est
msItem.explicit: Est et alius modus ligandi et soluendi qui per [CW: excommunicacionem]
msItem.author: REGINALD, CANON OF SHEDE
msItem.title: Dogma laicorum
msItem.note: A sermon handbook with models and additional material from the Fathers (misidentified as ‘dogma clericorum’ by a hand of s. xv, fol. 1, upper margin). No other copies of the text have been found. The scribe wrote ‘aue regina celorum’ before the text. Breaks off, at the end of a quire, in a chapter on papal power.
Added text:
‘Nouem preconia Iohannis Et ortum christi ’ (s. xv).

layoutDesc.layout:
In double columns, each column
155 52 , with 10 mm between columns, in 43 lines to the column. Frequent prickings; bounded and ruled in black and brown ink.

handDesc.handNote: Written in gothic textura semiquadrata, s. xiii1, but below top line; S. Harrison Thomson, ‘Three Anglo-Norman translations of the Veni Creator Spiritus’, Medium Aevum 8 (1939), 33–9 at 33, thought the scribe had been trained in Oxford. Punctuation by medial point and punctus elevatus.

decoDesc.decoNote: At textual divisions, 2- and 3-line alternate red and blue lombards, usually unflourished, with a few larger arabesque capitals and capitals in both colours.

msContents.textLang: Latin with an addition in Anglo-Norman

msItem.incipit: Sancti spiritus assit nobis gracia In Mathei xxi. Cum appropinquasset Legitur hoc ewangelium de utroque adwentu vnde legitur in prima dominica aduentus
msItem.explicit: experiantur set cum ueris hebreis lucem et refrigerium beati recipiant Quod nobis etc.
msItem.title: Unidentified sermon, like virtually all the collection.
msItem.note: These may be homilies prepared for parochial use, presumably by the PHILIP, vicar of Wycombe, who has added material in many lower margins (see “Provenance” below).

msItem.incipit: Dominica ija. ysaia Omnis uallis implebitur et omnis mons fratres karissimi in primis canticum ecclesie attendamus quod dicitur Expectetur ut pluuia uerbum domini
msItem.explicit: continue emittit aqua nos defendat dominus qui praua et aspera in directa facit amen

msItem.incipit: Dominica iija. Orietur in diebus eius iusticia et habundancia pacis Dilectissimi tempus istud vsque ad natale domini appellatur adventus domini Set notandum Quod triplex
msItem.explicit: cum mortali peccato alias tendat quam ad mortem eternam de qua eripiat nos dominus qui viuit
msItem.note: A new scribe writes the first column, but the main hand takes up at the top of fol. 73v.

msItem.incipit: Dominica iija. Quid existis in deserto uidere arundinem uento agitatam Per arundinem significantur superbi quia sicut arundo alta est sic et superbi
msItem.explicit: vir duplex animo inconstans est in omnibus viis suis etc. Estote prudentes sicut serpentes et simplices sicut columbe

msItem.incipit: In die Natalis domini Cristus hodie natus est gaudiamus Ne argui possim nihil uobis doctrine inpendisse quibus omnia debeo
msItem.explicit: quam saciabitur iustus cum eam uiderit quam oculus non uidit nec auris audiuit
msItem.author: WILLIAM DE MONTIBUS
msItem.title: sermo 69

msItem.incipit: In die circumcisionis Scindite prepucium cordium uestrorum id est superfiuitatem et inmundiciam Dies iste
msItem.explicit: infirmitates nostras contra medici nostri probicionem prohibicionem ideo scindite a vobis hanc superfluitatem

msItem.incipit: In die epiphanie Tria sunt munera magorum preciosa quia de thesauris regiis prolata
msItem.explicit: erant indignacionis et ex dolore amissi honoris non humilitatis et deuocionis
msItem.note: Also appears in Dublin, Trinity College MS 332, fol. 87rv and cf. sermon 10 from the anonymous collection in Avignon, Bibliotheque d’Avignon MS 591 (Schneyer, 8:76).

msItem.incipit: Dominica prima post epiphaniam Cvm factus esset ihesus annorum Moraliter Si wis ascendere ad ierusalem ad [later] celebrandum pascha necesse est ut puer ihesus
msItem.explicit: tribus enim dietis supradictis recedimus a deo Istis autem tribus impletis invenimus eum
msItem.note: Two contemporary additions to this sermon appear in the lower margins of fols. 78v–9.

msItem.incipit: Dominica ija. Nvpcie facte sunt in chana galilee Cana enim interpretatur zelus Galilea transmigracio Et bene quemlibet enim
msItem.explicit: multitudinem dolorum meorum in corde meo consolaciones tue letificauerunt animam meam
msItem.note: Cf. HUGH OF ST VICTOR, sermo 227 (Schneyer, 2:800), more distantly PHILIP THE CHANCELLOR, sermo 127 (4:827); there is also a copy at BL, MS Royal 3 A.x, fol. 110.

msItem.incipit: Cum descendisset ihesus de monte scilicet vbi nulli nisi discipuli ascendere potuerunt qui tipus sunt perfectorum
msItem.explicit: [fol. 81v] antequam ad portum salutis perueniret | quod fuit quando patri spiritum reddidit

msItem.incipit: Simile est regnum celorum homini qui seminauit Allegorice Regnum celorum ecclesia dicitur homo seminator cristus sicut ipse dominus
msItem.explicit: mercedem quia non est comprehensio brauii celestis nisi in vnitate fidei

msItem.incipit: Simile est regnum celorum patrifamilias Allegorice pater deus pater est Regnum celorum ecclesia uel uita iustorum
msItem.explicit: sicut beatus bernardus Ocium est nouerca uirtutum et nutrix viciorum

msItem.incipit: Dominica Exiit qui seminat seminare Sicut dicit beatus gregorius Hoc ewangelium non indiget exposicione set amonicione
msItem.explicit: quia secundum vitam et voluntatem consiliancium erit vita diuitum

msItem.incipit:
dominica [later]
Smpsit Sumpsit ihesus xiicim. discipulos litera patet Moraliter Ascensus iste significat ascensum in ierusalem supernam
msItem.explicit: Mundum illuminauit Vnde in Matheo Non sum missus nisi ad oves [CW: qui perierant]

msItem.incipit: Dominica prima post festum sancte trinitatis Ewangelium secundum lucam Homo quidam erat diues Nota quod dominus in hoc ewangelio principaliter agit contra auaros
msItem.explicit: Sciencia sanctorum est hic temporaliter affligi et in eternum cum domino gloriari Quod nobis etc.

msItem.incipit: Homo quidam fecit cenam magnam Nota quod matheus agit de prandie post quod restat cena
msItem.explicit: designantur que terrena ambiendo [altered to amvidendo?] quasi lambunt dum solis temporalibus delectantur

msItem.incipit: Erant apropinquantes ad ihesum publicani et pccores peccatores Publicani sunt qui publica uectigalia exigunt et lucra seculi per negocia
msItem.explicit: vt sic querat diligenter et dragmam reparatam inueniet [altered to -niat] et dicat congratulamini michi

msItem.incipit: Estote misericordes scilicet de peccatis propriis condolendo vnde ecclesiasticus Miserere anime tue placens deo
msItem.explicit: in progenie sua incurrit vnde Maledictus chani sit ipse seruus fratrum suorum

msItem.incipit: Cum turbe irruerent ad ihesum In hoc quod dicit irruerent notatur turbarum deuotio ut audirent
msItem.explicit: seruando amittimus largiendo seruamus Item gregorius Manus pauperis gazaphilacium dei est

msItem.incipit: Nisi habundauerit iusticia uestra Sicut dicit dominus in Matheo Non veni legem soluere set adimplere et hanc implecionem
msItem.explicit: In Mattheo Cum facis clemosinam noli tuba canere ante te sicut ypocrite faciunt

msItem.incipit: Cum turba multa premittit materiam miraculi Misereor super turbam In hoc quod | [fol. 96] dicit miseror notatur vera eius humanitas
msItem.explicit: set in penitentia plene manducabunt quando facie ad faciem deum videbunt

msItem.incipit: Attendite a falsis prophetis Intendit dominus in hoc ewangelio principaliter suos instruere ne fraudulenta simulacione
msItem.explicit: et manifesta sit Ardor in satisfactione rubiginem veteris peccati consumens

msItem.incipit: Homo quidam erat diues qui habebat uillicum Intendit dominus in hoc ewangelio principaliter invitare ad opera pietatis et dehortari
msItem.explicit: diuites in fide et heredes regni quod repromisit deus diligentibus se

msItem.incipit: Cvm apropinquaret ihesus jerusalem uidens ciuitatem In hoc ewangelio predicitur euersio ierusalem que facta est per principes romanos
msItem.explicit: in dignitatibus et prelacionibus primos et precipuos facit esse in suppliciis

msItem.incipit: Dixit ihesus ad quosdam qui in se confidebant tanquam iusti Ostendit dominus in hac parabola non fidei uerba set opera
msItem.explicit: subito enim ueniet ira eius et in die vindicte disperdet te

msItem.incipit: Exiens ihesus de finibus Alligorice exitus iste a tiro per sidonem ad mare Galilee transitum cristi significant
msItem.explicit: quia dicitur in proverbiis Qui seruat ficam suam fructus capiet ex ea

msItem.incipit: Beati oculi qui vident Oculi scilicet interiores non exteriores tantum quia pharisei corpus meum uiderunt
msItem.explicit: presentem que volebant interrogabant non per angelos uel varias species
msItem.note: Apparently the same as Cambridge, Gonville and Caius College MS 52/29, sermo 59; and BL, Royal 2 D.vi, sermo 39, both anonymous collections (Schneyer, 8:235, 450). The text breaks off after six lines at the quire end, on a page where the lower margin has been cut away.
Added texts (see also Provenance below)

msItem.incipit: Veni creator spiritus Seynt espirit ore venez | de nos le curages visitez
msItem.explicit: confortour | de secle al secle et a tuz iour’ Amen
msItem.title: An Anglo-Norman translation of ‘Veni creator spiritus’
msItem.note: ed. Thomson, 35–6. In the same hand which made additions to item 9.

msItem.incipit: Nota secundum FRANCISCUM DE MERONIS in suo sermone de Indulgenciis domini
msItem.title: a note outlining the distinction between pardon ‘a pena’ and ‘a culpa’
msItem.note: (this item and the next in mixed anglicana/secretary, s. xv med.).

msItem.incipit: Ibant tres boni fratres ad montem oliueti bonas herbas querentes omnia wlnera sanant’ et obuiauerunt domino nostro
msItem.title: a charm

supportDesc.collation: 7–88 [one or more lost quires] 98 1016 (–15, –16). A catchword at fol. 86 (most lower margins cut away); no signatures.
supportDesc.condition: The lower margins of fols. 91–4, 108 cut away.

layoutDesc.layout: In long lines, 22–32 lines to the page. The first quire pricked; bounds and rules in lead.
The opening portion (fols. 71–3) in double columns, each column usually 162 52 , with 10 mm between columns, in about 42 lines to the page.

handDesc.handNote: Most of the book in a single textura semiquadrata with sporadic but frequent anglicana letter forms (apparently above top line), s. xiii med. The opening portion (fols. 71–3) by other scribes. Punctuation by point, medial point, and occasional punctus elevatus.

decoDesc.decoNote: Headings in red and in text ink.
At the heads of the sermons, 1- and 2-line red lombards, some with later flourishing in text ink.
In work not by the main scribe, some use of red paraphs to divide the text.

msItem.rubric: Hic incipiunt constituciones magistri ROBERTI GROSSETESTE linconiensis episcopi
msItem.incipit: Debentes de vobis racionem bonam reddere que racio secundum Augustinum est dicere non tacere
msItem.explicit: transgrescione conuicti seu confessi fuerint nos eos pro posse nostro adiuuante domino nostro ihesu cristo canonice punituros
msItem.author: ROBERT GROSSETESTE
msItem.title: Constitutions
msItem.note: Ed. E M. Powicke and C. R. Cheney, Councils and Synods… II (Oxford, 1964), 1:267–76. Fols. 111v–12 have the table for the constitutions printed at 276–78, in double columns. Our MS is unnoted in the edition but was described by C. R. Cheney, English Synodalia of the Thirteenth Century, 2nd edn. (London, 1968), 113–14. Fols. 112v–13v were originally blank.
Added texts:

msItem.incipit: Predictus hugo episcopus dedit omnibus contritis confessis et vere penitentibus
msItem.explicit: summa pater noster et Aue maria Nemo scit nisi solus deus
msItem.title: A listing of indulgences offered by Hugh of Wells, bishop of Lincoln
msItem.note: (before 1209–35) inferentially 1228 x 1235, since some indulgences offered are associated with bishop Hugh Northwolde of Ely (1228–54). This item and the next two are written in anglicana, s. xiv in.

msItem.incipit: Venerabili pater in Cristo domino I dei gracia lincoln’ episcopo sue humiles et deuote Priorissa sancti Michaelis extra Stanford et eiusdem loci couentus salutem cum omni Reuerentiam pariter et honorem paternitati vestre reuerende dilectum nobis in cristo N de tali loco Acolit’
msItem.explicit: Reuerenda in domino Ihesu cristo Datus in capitulo nostro in [stained] sancte crucis Anno Domini MoCCCoiio
msItem.title: Letter from the convent of Benedictine nuns to John Dalderby, bishop of Lincoln (1299–1320), requesting the ordination of an acolyte to perform services.

msItem.incipit: Nouerint vniuersi nos Iohannem permissione diuina lincolnensis episcopum dilectum in cristo filium N dictum de D nostre diocesis ad omnes sacros ordines Reuerendo patri in cristo domino I dei gracia lincolnensis episcopo suus humilis et deuotus decanus de D cum summo obediencie debito Reuerentiam et honorem Nouerit vestra paternitas ueneranda quod N de C clericus
msItem.explicit: valeat paternitas Reuerenda in domino per tempora longiora Datus apud etc.
msItem.title: Further (form?) documents concerning the ordination of a priest.

msItem.incipit: O homo site videres tibi displiceris et michi placeris sed quia non vides O qui sedebit gloriosus in trono modo iacet sepultus in tumulo Quando sex cum limus res vilissimus simus | Vnde superbimus
msItem.title: A series of verses
msItem.note: none in Walther, added in anglicana, s. xv.

msItem.incipit: HOSTIENSIS de Matrimonio Est accio quare non debent iterum benedici qui secundas nupcias contrahunt quia quando prima
msItem.explicit: Cesset ergo stulta stultorum presumptuosa apprehensio Tam in vigilia pasce quam in ceteris diebus
msItem.title: Three notes on canon law
msItem.note: in anglicana, s. xiv med.

msItem.incipit: Venerabili viro et discreto domino N Rectori seu vicario Ecclesie de D dominus R perpetuus vicarius de C suus amicus salutem Quoniam proprium est et meritorium veritati testimonium peribere tenore presencium vobis significamus
msItem.explicit: patentes sigillo nostro consignatus Data apud C predictum in festo N Anno domini MoCCCColxxoiiijo.
msItem.title: A letter stating that one of R’s parishioners is free to marry in N’s parish
msItem.note: in anglicana with secretary a, s. xv ex.

layoutDesc.layout: In long lines, 30 lines to the page. Prickings; bounded and ruled in brown ink.

handDesc.handNote: Written in anglicana, s. xiii4/4. Punctuation by point, medial point, and occasional punctus elevatus.

decoDesc.decoNote: The text is divided by red-slashed capitals.
Red paraphs and red-slashed capitals at heads of entries in the table.

msItem.rubric: Incipit phisialogus liber bestiarum siue uolucrum siue uermium
msItem.incipit: Filium suum Iudam dicebat catulus leonis Iuda filius meus phisialogus dicit tres naturas habere leonem
msItem.explicit: in operibus bonis perseuerauerint transit gehennam ignis ardentis et non tangit eum flamma
msItem.title: Physiologus
msItem.note: Ed. E J. Carmody, Physiologus latinus: Editions préliminaires versio B (Paris, 1939), 11–52, the text ending in the discussion of the salamander. C. L. Kingsford (ed.), The Song of Lewes (Oxford, 1890), 86, 89 (nn. to 420–2, 433) notes our MS (as well as our MS 178) as possible sources of the locutions of the poem.
Added texts
blank portions of the final page are filled with theological notes, in incipient anglicana, probably s. xiii ex.

layoutDesc.layout: In long lines, 30 lines to the page. Prickings; bounded and ruled in lead.

handDesc.handNote: Written in textura semiquadrata, above top line, s. xiii in. Punctuation by point only.

decoDesc.decoNote: Two-line red lombards at the heads of sections.
A few marginal paraphs slashed in red.
Red heading at the opening and later spaces between chapters have wavy line-filler in red.
